text: Light golden, slightly hazy. Dry, somewhat yeasty aroma. High carbonation. Well balanced, not so sweet. Dry, somewhat bitter at the ens. Excellent!

Appearance is golden and lightly hazy, with a thin white head. Aroma has a big yeasty presence. Flavour is quite sweet, slightly malty with a spicy and floral finish.
Too carbonated.

Bottle. 
Pours clear amber with a big white frothy head, just as expected. Nice!
Aroma is somewhat faint and has malty sweetness, Meadowsweet and other herbs.
Taste is sugary sweet, has loads of herbal bitter goodiness going on, especially Meadowsweet, lots of yeast and clove.
Full body, smooth carbonation, dry mouth feel.
After taste is dry and bitter, not that long lingering.
Soild tripel! The body is quite big, that was unexpected. Still super easy to drink. More herbs and bitterness than other tripels Ive tried.
Tap at Lambiczoon, Milano, 2nd May 2017. Pours amber, aroma of malts, yeast, some grassy hops. Taste is complex, yeast, bitter, citrus. Very nice nice for a Triple, not normally my style.

Sockerartad maltbas och en aromatiskt kryddig doft. Förvånansvärt svag doft.
Mycket vacker gyllene bärnstensfärg, disig. Tätt skum med hög hållfasthet.
Honungssöt smak med lätt kryddig ton och inslag av jäst. 
Ganska tunn kropp och en fruktig, något torr avslutning.

75cl bottle @La Maison Belge, Madrid. Around 2010.
In short:average triple.
Pours some hazy deep gold with frothy rocky white head. Long head retrention, some lacing. Herbal, some caramel and malty aromas.Medium body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is weet, boozy, little harsh due to high carbonation, spicy.

En dégustant des bières comme cette Rulles triple, on comprend pour quoi les bières belges sont inscrites au patrimoine mondial de lUNESCO, tant la maîtrise du brassage est poussée à un haut niveau avec un travail remarquable à la fois sur le malt et sur le houblon. Cette Rulles est une réelle référence du style avec un équilibre et une homogénéité simplement parfaits, à la fois ronde et puissante autour darômes fruités, fleuris et épicés. En verre, cette triple se veut dun blond légèrement voilé (EBC de 13), parée de très fines bulles et dune mousse blanche, crémeuse de 5 mm. Le nez est une splendeur, sur les céréales, les agrumes, les fruits exotiques et la coriandre, à la fois frais et profond, complexe et accessible. La dégustation ne le fera en aucun cas mentir, avec une attaque souple, orientée sur lamertume, des arômes de céréales de miel et relevées par de la coriandre et dune petite pointe dacidité très à propos. La deuxième bouche, toujours avec une prépondérance de lamertume est davantage fruité et floral. Cependant, larrière bouche, sur un équilibre splendide et plus orienté sur le malt propose des notes épicées avec notamment la girofle permettant de donner de la profondeur à la bière. La troisième bouche présente alors une amertume fine et précise avant un final, long, qui souvre et qui gagne en ampleur et en richesse sur des arômes pleins de céréales, dagrumes et dépices (notes plus poivrées). Tout est juste dans cette triple, lalcool à 8,4 % qui la structure superbement, le sucre, sans faute, léquilibre malt/houblon....Nous sommes tous riche de ce patrimoine, merci à la Belgique
75cl bottle. hazy orange color. medium white head. peppery yeast, malts, fruits, citrus. medium carbonation. low to mid bitterness.

Aroma has yeast, citrus, spiciness. Taste is malty with quite long spicy aftertaste. Flavors of citrus, yeast, spices, coriander.

750ml bottle. Pours a cloudy orange with lots of sediment floating around and a large, thick, fluffy, white head that leaves curtains of lace. Sweet aroma of yeast, caramel malt, spice, peach and orange. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, orange peel, peach, yeast, honey, sugar, lemon and pepper with a dry, mildly bitter, warming booze finish. Medium body with a smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Nicely done.

Pours orange amber with medium creamy white head. Good lacing. Hay, orange, earth, dough, honey, bit of ginger, some vanilla. Strong nice yeast aromas. Medium sweet, medium bitter, rather strong bitter peppery finish. Medium body, watery to oily texture. Soft to average carbonation. Awesome

Bottle shared at the London tasting, October 2016. I am surprised i have not rated this before. Dark yellow color, off white foam on top. Aroma has yeast, sweet malt, some flowers. Flavor is medium sweet, much sweet than a Westmalle tripel. More flowers, plants, a little sugar. Good palate.

Clear, golden colored, medium+ frothy white head. Aroma is of sweet malt, brewing sugar, fruity and spicy notes, some Belgian yeast. Taste is medium sweet malt, brewing sugar, some fruity notes, spicy, Belgian yeast, light honey, bit peppery, medium spicy bitterness with a dry finish and a lasting spicy bitter aftertaste. Medium+ bodied, average carbonation, oily. 
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)
Classic aroma of yeast, citrus, spices, hints of alcohol, golden with a thin white head not very persistant, medium body, medium carbonation, citrus...very pleasant and classic belgian tripel.

Hazy blond colour with thick fluffy head. Strong yeasty aroma and taste. Its quite dry. Theres a particular bitterness on the back of the tongue. Slight honeyed sweetness in the finish. Feels a bit boozy.

750 ml bottle. Unclear golden body with a medium sized, lacing white head. Aroma has malt, honey and spices with Belgium yeast. Flavor is sweet malt, ripe fruit, spices, yeast, mild, slightly harsh bitterness and some warming alcohol. Medium body and average aftertaste. Quite nice but not outstanding.

BB backlog, Bottle, pours a hazy golden with small to medium sized white head. Smell is belgian fruit, wood, figs, dates, and lemon rind. Flavor was most of the same with some bread pudding and other dark fruits mixed in. Body is medium to heavy with soft carbonation

UPDATED: APR 27, 2017 Notes of caramel, rye bread a pleasant warmess, notes of mature Caco. In mouth is full and rich, the mouth is wrapped by a complex diversity of sweetness. Is a very balanced beer and super satisfactory. I love it 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Solid. golden with a nice sweet aroma and a dry finish. About as good as a Tripel can get.
Bottle.Pours golden with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, some fruitiness, herbs and yeast. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some malt, yeast and herbs. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle split at Islo tasting, cheers to Dave Wingmane, 04/10/16. 
Lightly hazed golden orange with a decent off white covering.
Nose is melon, straw, orange marmalade, bread, light yeast esters, grassy.
Taste comprises airy malts, caramel, tangerine, grass, light spice.
Medium bodied with bite, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a schmack of booze.
A touch harsh and rough around the edges for me.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: October 2016 - Bottle share at CBC Islington. As La Rulles Triple, 8.4%, currently a top 50 abbey tripel. Many thanks to Dave! Dark matte golden yellow, hazy with a huge foamy dense white head, full lacing. Aroma is airy, minty, soap and crackers. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is smooth sugary malts, spicy, crackers, touch of booze, crisp. A tasty tripel which grew on me. (3.5)

Bottle at the JK London tasting. It pours cloudy amber with a thick white head. The aroma is earthy, woody, cereal, touch of paper, apple, pear and cracker. The taste is soft, sweet, sugary, some alcohol boost, cracker, paper, earthy, cereal, touch of spice, wood nougat and bread. Medium+ body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Decent example of the style. Its just a shame the style aint that great...!

Aroma is lemon, booze, orange, Carmel, dank. Appearance is a hazy orange with a thin sheet of foam and some chunky lacing. Taste is lemon, orange, Carmel, skunk, pepper, yeast. Palate is medium bodied with some sweetness in the front and and dry bitter finish. Overall- a decent tripel, more hops than most but not unbalanced.

0.75l bottle. Slightly hazy orange body with a huge white head. Aroma of hay, lemon zest, gooseberry with citrusy and floral hops. Taste of hay, dark sugar, licorice, lemon zest, orange peel and some floral hops. Very nice tripel from the hoppier end of the category.

75cl bottle shared at JK tasting, London. Many thanks to Wingman for this one. It pours a clean golden color with a large white head. Aroma is sweet with some herbal notes. Taste is also sweet and malty with notes of caramel and light herbs. Medium bodied with OK carbonation. Overall, OK

Bottle shared at the CBC Islington for the jk tasting. Many thanks. A hazed orange golden coloured pour with a small white head . Aroma is Belgian yeast, mineral, little grassy hop, nutty malts, hot alcohol. Flavour is composed of semi sweet Belgian yeast, nutty. Mineral.

Draft taster at Churchkey courtesy of GenDV110+OT, thanks Donnie! Hazy gold with rim of white head. A: some lite spice, grains, flora, tea. T: slightly sour flora and wet hay, grains, spice, green tea. Decent.

Bouteille 75 cl. Mousse à fines bulles relativement persistante. Robe : orange ambrée très belle. Nez : agrumes, ananas, malt, ... Goûts : orange, sucre en quantité adéquate, épices (poivre), amertume moyenne. Bière ronde, gouleyante et rafraîchissante. Un des tout bons produits de la brasserie.

Bottle at home. Clear golden colour with a rocky white head that subsides a little. Not a massive hop-bomb but the aroma is very attractive: resinous yet floral. The taste has the requisite tripel sweetness but this is backed with a huge bitterness. Flavours of yeast spicyness, vanilla and juicy malt and fruit. Rich mouthfeel, a slight sugary backtaste and a long bitter, dry finish. Reveals more nuances with every sip. Excellent.
4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Thanks DCLawyer! Hazy orange with off-white head. Aromas of herb, citrus, spice. Tastes of malt, herb, citrus, light spice. Medium body with a dry finish.
On draft at Churchkey. Pours a cloudy gold with an off white head. Aroma of wet hay. Flavors of caramel with a hint of peppermint. On the sweet side, but pretty tasty.

Bottle, 75cL. Home. A golden orange clear beer with a big white foamy head ; great retention. Fruits (citrus), herb, light roast, light biscuit, alcohol. Medium dry fresh bitter, light warming atmosphere, light to medium sweet. Medium good body, light to medium oily texture, average carbonation, sweet herbal warming finish. Overall, a pleasant triple belgian ale ; too sweet for me.

Bottle, Restobières, Brussels. Gold, with a light haze. Thin, dense, lasting, bright white head. Nose is bready and yeasty. Some vanilla custard malts. Orange syrup. Some damp grain. Taste has fruity, grapefruit bitterness, with rich, bready, yeasty sweetness. Medium to full body. Soft, silky rich mouthfeel. More bitterness on the finish. For me, this is more like a Belgian version of a big, double IPA. Whatever, its a hugely tasty, easy drinking beer.

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Hazy amber body with a thick off-white head. Faint lacing. Aroma of salted lemon, herbs and bread. Flavour of grapefruit pith, hay, bitter lemon and floral hops. Medium body with a frothy texture. Soft fizz. Its not particularly complex, but its well-hopped Tripel - very drinkable and refreshing for the ABV. Yet another good beer from this brewery.
Hazy yellow body with a white head that leaves loads of lacing. Light and fruity flavor with a clear yeast presence. Well carbonated with soft bubbles.

Aroma is quite fresh and fruity with citrus and some light sweet maltyness. Taste has light malts, bread and citrus and honey. Modern hoppy variant of the tripel. Refreshing.

Goudgeel, volle witte schuimkraag die blijft, wazig, veel koolzuur activiteit zichtbaar. 
Aroma: Fruitig zoet, perzik, kruidig, bloemig en licht moutig.
Smaak: Iets karamel, zoet fruit, citrus , iets gist / banaan, zoete mouten, een peperige / netelige hopbitter die lang aanhoud. Iets alcohol warmte.
Body is medium, voldoende koolzuur en redelijk actief en scherp mondgevoel. Afdronk is bitter en iets droog met een mooi fruitige noot. Goed in balans!
Goede tripel
Hazy golden color. Sweet aromas, yeast and fruits. Taste is dominated by the yeast with a sweet, malt base, some fruit. Some bitterness and spices during the finish.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity smel with almonds. Similar taste. Slightly boozy, but not too bad. Nice!

Obfita, początkowo drobna piana, średnio trwała, nieznacznie oblepiająca szkło. Barwa złota, delikatnie opalizująca. Aromat winogronowy, brzoskwiniowy, kwiatowy i ziołowy po trosze. W smaku sporo winogronowej słodyczy, kandyzowane owoce, suszone morele, przyprawy w typie różowego pieprzu... Goryczka niska, może nieco powyżej, ziołowa, lekko cierpkie i szorstkie w odczuciu. Wysycenie średnie, praktycznie nie czuć alkoholu.
Fajny Tripel, dość słodki, z perfekcyjnie ukrytym ponad 8% ABV, nieco szorstko cierpki w aftertejsie.

Tripel à lodeur sucré, mais qui laisse transparaître une touche damertume lorsque bien froide. Plus quelle se réchauffe, le côté sucré et les levures belges prennent le dessus, nous donnant un breuvage facile daccès qui plait à merveille.

Tap @ Akkurat, Stockholm. Cloudy brown with a whip-creamy white head. Nose is quite perfumey; roses, honey, clover and mandarins. Buzzy, medium to full body, oily with a surprising hop presence. Good balance of toffee and bitter grass. Quite simple but oh so nice!

Une triple magnifique à la robe blonde légèrement ambrée, au nez puissant et complexe avec à la fois du fruit, des épices, une pointe maltée et houblonnée et une très belle note levurée typique de Rulles. la bouche est tout aussi remarquable avec de la puissance, de la profondeur, du fruit, de la longueur et de léquilibre. Jadore....
Medium white head, chestnut golden coloured body, yeasty fruitt peach apple smell, medium carbonation and bitter, yeasts herby hops caramel warm taste
Ugjennomsiktig med lavt hvitt skum. Aroma av krydder, sitrus og gjær. I smaken er det mye samme.
Tap at viisi penniä, helsinki. Hazy deep golden, white head. Aroma has citrus, yeast, some fruits. Balanced taste, citrus, yeasty notes.
Tap at Oluttupa Viisi Penniä, Helsinki. Colour is cloudy light orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, pineapple, spices, sweetness and malts.

75cl bottle. Poured on a Westmalle calice. Golden with a thin creamy head, quite clear but with a yeasty sediment in the bottle. Aroma is very typical of belgian tripels, malted grain, yeasty, spices. Taste is moderately sweet for a tripel, with a drier, lightly alcoholic and bitter aftertaste. The palate is extremely smooth and dense with millions of very small bubbles. All in all this beerl is much more drinkable and balanced than most tripels. This one really reconclied me with the classical belgian style. Quite simple but impressively well made.

Bottle from Deconinck, Vichte - BE. Color: clear blond beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: malt and floral notes. Saison yeast. Herbal notes. Taste: medium body with superb caramel malt and toffee notes. Good tripel, with nice attenuation. Honey and toffee notes. Aftertaste: toffee and honey. Sweet malt. Yeast and small alcohol.

Bottle 0,75L. Murky orange/ocher color with small, long lasting, frothy white head and fair lacing. Fruity aroma of apple, pear, pineapple, banana and similar with touch of fruity yeasts and peppery spices. Taste has the same level of bitterness from start to the end with slightly grassy finish. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, metallic finish. Kinda like it...
Superbe triple! Un côté floral, poivrée. Un alcool enveloppé à merveille. Le visuel est magnifique, le corps est parfait, la mousse tient le coup... la vie est belle!

2015/01/10 - Pours a clear copper/amber colour with a thick, foamy, off white head that lingers and leaves ample lacing. Aroma is light funk, sweet grain, honey, light pepper, coriander, yeast, candied sugar, dried dark fruit and light citrus. Taste is yeasty sweet bread, light pepper and spice, banana, candied sugar and light citrus. Mouthfeel is medium and slick with smooth carbonation and a drying, mildly sweet finish. Reminds me of a triple mixed with a dunkel weiss. Interesting and delicious triple.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, Belgian yeast, flowers, fruit, hops and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque amber/brown beer with medium yeast and with a small/medium white/off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium sweet and slightly bitter with malts, Belgian yeast, flowers, fruit, hops and spices.

Pale deep golden pour with a thin white head .... Aroma of fruity yeast, candi sugar, coriander and a light grassy hop ..... Taste is of fruity yeast, sweet candi sugar, coriander (think lemon/lime) and some orange with grassy hop notes .... Soft and smooth mouthfeel .... Finish has lingering fruity yeast and citrusy flavors ... Nice tripel

On tap at Selden Standard. Pours a hazy orange with a slight gold hue and a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a nice grassy and flora combination with sweet grains and Belgian yeast supporting. Flavor has grass and light citrus up front with growing flora and sweet grains supported by Belgian yeast.

750ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy golden with a big white head, good lacing. Fruity aroma, citrus, apricot, red apples, pears, herbs and yeast. Medium bodied with a creamy smooth and rounded mouthfeel. Several big tastes in balance, pear, red apple, banana, citrus zest, orange, apricot, white pepper, clove and herbs. Grassy and earthy hops and classical Belgo yeast lifts the fruit and herbal/spicey taste. Long finish with citrus zest and herbs. Very enjoyable!

750 ml bottle into chalice, bottled in 1/2015. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy bright golden orange color with a 1 finger dense and rocky off white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big lemon, orange, apricot, pear, apple, white grape, pepper, clove, light banana, honey, biscuit, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast, pale malt, and citrus/earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big lemon, orange, apricot, pear, apple, white grape, pepper, clove, light banana, honey, biscuit, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Moderate amount of herbal bitterness/yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, orange, apricot, pear, apple, grape, pepper, clove, honey, biscuit, and herbal/yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/spicy yeast, pale malt, and citrus/earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/yeast/spiciness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from yeast spice and hop bitterness as well. Medium carbonation and body; with and very smooth and lightly creamy/bready/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is well hidden with only a light warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an excellent tripel style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/spicy yeast, pale malt, and citrus/earthy hop flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.
Alla spina. Una buona tripel, piuttosto classica e bilanciata, non particolarmente intensa ma dissetante e "contenuta".

Flasche, 0.75l Orange-golden. Leicht trübe. Dichter, lang anhaltender Schaum. Floraler Duft. Etwas Pfirsich. Leicht säuerliche Hefearomatik. Weißbrot. getrocknete Aprikosen. Bitterkeit recht präsent. Ebenso die 8,5% - dennoch sehr süffig.

Bottle from Beergium. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, yeast, hops, earthy notes and grass. Unbalanced body with surprisingly few aromas for a tripel. Bitter finish with citrus, yeast, earthy notes and hops. Good tripel, but rather disappointing considering the reputation.
Leicht trübes goldenes Bier mit einer mittelgroßen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch süß malzig, hefig, etwas Banane. Geschmack süß malzig, sehr bananig, hefig, leicht alkoholisch.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2015 Arancio con buona schiuma pannosa. Birra molto composta sia al naso che al palato, con aroma fruttato. Amaro minimo, si avverte il Dolce del malto e note fruttate. Bene l?alcol. Molto precisa ma non entusiasma quanto speravo.
Flaska från SB. Doftar kryddigt, något sött brödigt, lite bärigt, koriander. Smakar av maltsötma och värmande och kryddiga alkoholtoner. Bra humlebett.

75 cl bottle thanks to Dunbar72! Sampled on September 19, 2015.Cloudy orange color, off-white head. Sweet, sugary, alcohol, spicy, yeasty scent. Malty, sweet, bitter, yeasty taste. Yeasty, alcohol aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness.
Bottle from SB. Hazy pale yellow with a thick white head. Spicy and flowery tones. Flowers, spices, fruit and bitterness. Medium to full body with a long bitter / spicy finish.

750ml green bottle poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is hazy amber with a large frothy off-white head, that reduced quickly leaving some lacing. Aroma of pears, lemon zest, banana and herbs. Flavours of lemon zest, spices, caramel, orange peels, bread and pears. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is full bodied, smooth texture and average carbonation. La Rulles Triple is a great Triple, maybe a little too sweet.
UPDATED: APR 28, 2016 Hazy yellow body with a white head that leaves loads of lacing. Light and fruity flavor with a clear yeast presence. Well carbonated with soft bubbles.
Köpt från Belgoklubben. Disig bärnstenfärgad med generös smutsvit skumkrona. Doft av jäst, rök och citrus. Mediumsöt kropp. Rökig smak av torv, wurst, hö, apelsin och lite salmiak.

Golden pour. Big white head. Plenty of lacing. Nice sugary note in the nose with some faint hop notes. Malty as well. Taste is a dry yet sweet sugar note. Tripels just arent my thing, but this one is decent.
Golden brown with a big white head. Nose is syrup, grapefruit, lightly alcohol. Very complex mouth sensation, nicely balanced sweetness and bitterness. Very smooth and nice beer!

Bottle 75 cl. I have had this MANY times and it is even greater on tap. This review is from bottle however. Semi-hazy orange/goöden color, three finger dirty white fluffy head that dissipates slowly leaving lots of lacings. Aroma is elegant with citrus, orange, phenolicish tomatoe juice, grass, flowers, soft spicy yeast tone. Taste is starting citrusy bitter with sugar on the back, escalating spicy yeasty tone, sour dough, tomato juice, more orange feel, ends with a spicy, citrusy dryness. Medium body, low to medium carbo, rich and crisp rustic mouthfeel. So damn elegant, this is the best beer I have had from one of my absolute favourite breweries. This brewery rule(les)!

Pour on tap at Crunchys, clear golden-yellow pour with white head, aroma brought notes of sweet vanilla, pineapple, pear, peach into a bit of grass, bread, touch of doughy notes with a hint of grain. Taste was a mix of orange, pear, peach into some spice, biscuit, bread, touch of booze, finishing fairly sweet.

bottle at home. Pours hazy dark yellow with a little creamy head. Very strong yeasty nose with quite some floral and light malt characters. Medium body, medium sweet but with quite some yeast components, nice sweet bitter finish. Taste is saison alike yeast, sweet pale malts, dry bitter pine. Rough, but very nice.
Bottle at hoppy loft brussels . Candy and butter in the aroma . Smooth palate . Notes of grapes , vibrant palate .
A fantastic triple. Maybe one of the better ones Ive had. Lots of sweet Belgian pastry, and sweet bitter flavours. No alcohol detected. All the flavours shine in this.
Flaska från Belgoklubben. Ljust bärnstensfärgad med vitt skum. Fruktig doft med en del humle. Lätt och trevlig med jäst och frukt.

Hazy golden body with a long-lived white head, good lacing. Strong aroma of Belgian yeast, spices, faint fruits, honey, pale malts and sugar. Strong flavour of Belgian yeast, spices, alcohol and honey. Moderate sweet taste with a moderate to light bitter long-lasting finish. Mid-bodied, a bit dry, rather lively carbonation. A very nice tripel! 
[75 cl bottle shared with Svensenga smak & behag, from Vinmonopolet Online]
Flaska 75 cl belgolådan. Disig orange kulör med vitt skum. Doft av äppelmos, vin och hö. Lätt söt smak med äpple, gräs, örter jäst. Spritsig kolsyra mjuk avslutning
Tap @ Delirium Café, Brussels 14/5-15. Yeasty, fruity and spicy. Body is medium, the finish is dry.

75cl bottle, 2014 from notes. Cloudy golden pour, very nice whipped eggwhite head. Classic BE tripel with a good malt base sweetness to balance out the Rulles trademark assertive grassy hop bitterness. Nearly no abv fumes here, allowing the peach/pear esters and some pepper to break through, whilst not really making any of them shine due to a starchy mid. Still well drinkable, good mouthfeel.

Bottle.
hazy deep yellow, white head.
apricot and floral aromal.
bitter taste, sweet. Nice feel. Fresh and fizzy.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2016 Rating from old notes, tasted this at a Zythos Bierfestival (in Sint-Niklaas, I think 2005) but apparently overlooked it when entering my old ratings here. Peach blonde beer with yellowish white, moussy head and yeasty as well as lightly spicy hoppy aroma, bit phenolic, bit estery; fruity taste, yeasty but not too dull, light citrussy freshness, sweetish malts with a caramelly touch, full mouthfeel, herbal and lightly spicy but otherwise rather subdued hop bitterness in the finish. Certainly not unpleasant, in fact a rather interesting one in this somewhat tedious Belgian style, but Id have to taste this anew, as I assume it has inevitably changed in ten years time.  Seeing how some eminent British raters rave over this, my curiosity to revisit this is only sparked.

Top Belgian tripel. Aroma of hops, malts and yeast, the way it should be. All well balanced, no offflavors. Very floral and grainy, quite rustic smell to it. Taste is decent tripel, where again hop malts and yeast are so balanced. Mild bitterness, toasted grainy aftertaste and a nice yeasty aftertaste (orval yeast i think). Hops are typical for the Ardenne brews, very floral and grassy. 
After drinking a lot of IPAs or RIS or Pepper infused salted smoked dingdong beers, a good Belgian tripel wil ALways stand out. This one is for me one of the best Belgian tripels.

Soyons clair : bière dont le seul petit défaut est dêtre capsulée et non bouchonnée 
(et encore, dans ce cas-ci, et par la plus grande exception, je partage la pratique du 
brasseur si elle a permis de maintenir toutes les qualités de cette bière extraordinaire).
Pour le reste, nous sommes en présence dune merveille pure.
Mon exemplaire est un 75 cl de 20 mois dâge (alors que le brasseur préconise une
date-limite à 18 mois dâge).
Couleur doré brillant magnifique, voire parfait (pour une triple bien entendu).
Clarté pure, cristalline.
Bulles fines à moyennes par milliers.
Mousse blanc un peu cassé, bien crémeuse au centre et qui tient facilement à 1 cm.
Arômes de blé, épices, houblon aromatique et amer, herbes fines.
1ère bouche à la texture soyeuse, extrêmement fine, qui constitue un magnifique ensemble
dune fraîcheur magique : blé, levure, houblon, avec une pointe de coriandre et de girofle
très fine.
2ème bouche dune texture incroyable comme du sable micrométrique, dune finesse parfaite,
et dune granulométrie inimaginable.
3ème bouche dun équilibre prodigieux avec des houblons extraordinaires.
Arrière-bouche avec une pointe dépice particulière, du type dun poivre gris ultrafin.
La longueur procure encore dautres nuances splendides, toujours fraîches et fines.
Ces nuances sont quasi miraculeuses parce quelles touchent à tous les registres dune 
triple.... Fraîcheur, amertume, céréales, houblon, levure. Splendide.
Levure fine, complexe, parfaite pour le sujet de la triple.
Alcool parfait, 8,4 % abv qui travaillent 84 fois les saveurs. Magique.
Finale strictement prodigieuse : un feu dartifices de saveurs pour compléter les impressions
précédentes perçues dans la longueur.
Conclusion : une merveille des merveilles, un sommet de lart brassicole. Cette petite brasserie
de la Gaume belge égale ainsi des bières de grand renom, et de classe mondiale. 
Un prodige qui mérite le plus grand respect. (Entre nous, 5 est ridicule, je cote à 555 sur 100).

Appearance: orange with suspended specs and bits. Airy bready head fades slowly with acres of lace, a full collar, and blotches splattered throughout. Swirls equally impressive.

Nose: yeasty, spicy, doughy. Grains of paradise. Baled hay, dry grass. Zing of green banana skin and lemon zest.

Palate: chewy. Tingle of flambéed boozed spiced green bananas, plantains, grass, and lemon peel. Residual spiced oaky orange peel. Lively and playful. Rustic and of the fields along the edges  baled straw and dried grass. Gentle tickle of heat in the chest which is soothing and enticing, spicy and oaky.

Final Thoughts: fantastic! My initial and original love for Belgian beers is once more reinstated and reaffirmed. La Rulles Triple was delicious and I hope I get to explore more of their beers soon and always.

The nose has some light citrus as well as a nice bit of spice and Belgian yeast. Good hop character. The taste is along the same lines with a nice spice, citrus rind, and some hops. Good feel and a nice body; everything integrates well. A nice drinkable brew.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 11-14-2010

Appearance: Orange blond. Slightly hazy. Lots of white, creamy head.
Aroma: Fruit, hops. Lemon. Slight alcohol.
Taste: Fruit and hops. Lasting bitterness. Spices.
Info: 750ml bottle, 3/3-2011, 35/100
A dark yellowish orange color with some brown sugar, caramel, spices in the nose. The flavor is dry with a floral presence. Some citrus, brown sugar showing. Overall pretty good

(bottle, 75cl) Cloudy, golden coloured hue with loads of floaties and a blond medium-sized foamy head. Moderately sweet malty and fruity aroma with notes of grapefruit, oranges, accompanied by a touch of barnyard. Sweet-bitter flavour, full bodied with a spritzy carbonation. Solid malt-character with fruity and yeasty accents, again lighter notes of barnyard; medium-dry fruity and quite zesty bitter finish with a lasting fruity, slightly hoppy and malty aftertaste. 02.III.11

Bottle. A hazy golden coloured pour with a large healthy white head on top. Sweet, honey, fruity aroma. Tastes sweet, honey, spice, orange, citrus fruit. Nicely balanced and warming. Had this on tap at Delirium Brussels many times too. An excellent Belgian tripel.

Bottle: Golden, hazy & floaties visible, firm lacy off-white head; moderate to solid sweet fruity-zesty nose (oranges, orange-peel); almost slightly dry bitter-sweet flavour, quite soft and medium bodied; a slight tartness shows up in the sweet-zesty finish. Solid quality....
Creamy browned head on a darker brown body with some soap bubble.  Musk, farm housy, sourdough tinged amber malt. Replete with melanoidins. Dry and tart body, sourdough tangy.

Au fût @ Delirium
Dorée, blanche.
Arôme en général qui garde une note de levure belge, fruité allant vers des notes esters, cette levure donne une impression de cave.
Au palais, levure belge, note houblon fleuri, aspect ester/fruité qui termine sur une fine amertume. Une bonne triple qui garde aussi ce côté blé et grains tout en mélangeant amertume et douceur.
Draft at double windsor. Just another one of your standard tripkles. Nice color. Gikder peach. Head and lacin fades smells of lemon poine and honey. Tasye is boozy biyt drinkable. Nmot bad
Tap. Slightly hazy light orange pour with a pillowy white head. Sweet fruity yeast nose. Clove, banana, and yeast on taste. Good stuff.
Really nice belgi-style ale. Fruits and also some malt in taste, very fresh ale indeed.
8th March 2009 Hazy amber beer. Good white head but dies quickly. Aromatically sweet start and with a soft palate. Smooth malt with a subtle undertone of brandyish alcohol. Crisp semi dry finish.

Bottle @ home.  Pours a dark yellow-orange appearance with a two finger pearl white head.  Slightly skunky aroma from afar.  A closer smell results in a yeasty, fruity, Belgian tripel aroma.  Flavor is pretty full with a spicy, yeasty flavor on top of a fruity Abbey Tripel flavor.  Slightly yeasty aftertaste.  Pretty smooth but a bit bread-like and a bit unsweet for my Abbey Tripel taste.
75cl bottle. Hazy yellow with medium-sized white head. Fruity nose with orange, spices and malt. Flavour is slightly sweet malt, orange peel, clove, some bitterness and alcohol. Quite dry aftertaste.

I usually drink this beer on tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, but sometimes I also buy it in bottle. This Belgian triple has a very appreciable flavour, even if I dont assimilate it to the most known trappist beers, which are absolutely more complex instead. Finally I can say it presents a well balanced flavour based on hop, sweet and spiced. Very nice.

(Bottle, 0.75 l, BBE March 12) The beer poured golden and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, hops, hint of honey and sweetness. Palate was medium bodied and warming with quite high carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, hops, hint of honey, sweetness, Belgian style yeast, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was yeasty, fruity and bitter. For a tripel this was pleasantly dry and also hops were quite clearly present but they werent overdone.

Another recommendation by the bartender at Delirium Cafe on 12-09-10 (3,50 euro). Almost completely clear with a slight haze. Bright golden color with a nice white head. Smooth with almost no alcohol in the pallet. A bit of a soapy mouth feel (not bad). Overall a fairly sessionable triple, Similar but with more body then Victorys Golden Monkey.

Pours a hazy orange yellow with medium amount of foamy offwhite head.  Aroma is lemon and yeasty doughiness.  Flavor is dry and yeasty spiciness with wheat doughy base.  Finish is dry floral bitter.  Overall, nothing special .

750ml bottle from Alko

Rather simple but nevertheless tasty and sweet triple
Pours hazy yellow with a high and thick head. Aroma is malts, hops and alcohol. Flavor is a bit bitter with malts, hops, pineapple and alcohol. Enjoyable triple.

0.75 l bottle from Alko. Copper color. The aromas of honeyish malt, perfumed spiciness and fruitiness in good balance. Sweetish fairly malty taste for a tripel with pineapple, clove, fruity tartness and some herbal hops and herbal bitterness in finish. Hint of alcohol sharpness. This is pretty much what I expect from a well crafted tripel.

75cl bottle. Poured hazy, orange looking color with a frothy, nice lacing white head. Aroma is orange peel, yeast and some spices. Flavor is fruity malty, with some yeast and spices (at least coriander). Nice alcohol warming. Finish is quite dry and spicy. Excellent tripel, one of the best I have tried.
On tap at Delirium. Dark brown. Big head. Floral nose. Taste is quite sweet, also notes of citrus and ginger. Quite strong. Prickly texture.

750 ml discounted bottle from Canals Hainesport. Poured a ciderish amber brown body with a smaller off white tight foamy head. Aroma is loaded with sweetness, sort of like a blend of a wet pile of malts, sugar, hay adn some fruit. Interesting though. The body is solid with a medium to fuller mouthfeel and despite the flater appearance the body is rather lively. Flavor of Belgian yeast, candi sugar coated fruits, hay, grains. Nice beer actually, plus I didnt even pay full price.....suckers its an Fn Tripel it will last for years bitches!

750 ml bottle. Finland.
Hazy dark copper colour with tiny off-white head.
Spices, some hops, sweet caramel, plums and fruity xmas in sweetish aroma.
Flavour is bitterish hops, dark fruits, malt, flour and sweet sugar.

{thoughts} Masterfully balanced sweet-spicy-sparkling, complex earthy-herbal undertones, rich malts. This is beer.

{elements}Hazy, dark peach hue; tight, creamy, white head. Primary aroma of crackers, honey and sesame with a tease of lemon zest and white grapes; interestingly smoky, almost fudgy, character likely yeast derived; softly herbal, forceful floral character. Gentle sweetness with well balanced acidity and bitterness; the latter is forceful enough, though never so much as to distract from the yeast and malts. Bright, scrubbing carbonation, medium body, creamy texture. Alcohol is detectable, but neither harsh nor intrusive, and yet the beer drinks like one half its size. 75 cl bottle, best before February 2012.

Colour of honey. Overwhelming head. At first I am surprised that this has the aroma of your average pale lager with some fruitiness. Then I notice the hop aroma too and it reminds me of spruce. Fruity flavour with some sweetness to it. Soft carbonation.

Bottled. Pale straw yellow beer. Rocky white head. Aroma has lots of fresh fruits and yeast esters. Aromatic, herbal hoppiness. Citrus peel, coriander and some peppery spiciness. Maybe ahint of strawberries. Good amount of dry pils malts, candi sugar gives balancing sweetness. Finishes dry, bitterish and slightly alcoholic. Well balanced, fresh, smooth, rich and interesting. Lovely.
750 ml bottle. Hazy yellowish orange colour, thick white head. Aroma of malts, citrus fruits and spices. The flavour is sweetish malty, with dried fruits, and a lingering, warm, spicy, hoppy finish.

Bottled 750ml (Alko, BB 03/2012)
A bit hazy yellow-orange color, small white head. Fruity Belgian yeasty nose with leather, hops, countryside and peach. Medium-bodied. Very Saison-like flavor: fresh grassy hoppyness, spices, fruity yeastyness in the background. Lingering bitterness with a punch of alcohol in the aftertaste. This is quite refreshing, although strong Summer drink. And IMHO Saison, not a triple.

Bottle 750 cl. Goldenyellow hazy colour and a white long-lasting head. Aroma is sweet and dry fruit. Flavour is dry citrus, malty and a bitterness that comes in the end. Some spices are there too. Leaves a nice lacing on the glass.

Pours gold with no haze but a fine floating sediment (slight difference).  The head is tall, billowing white and when this eventually lows there is a substantial lacing.  On the nose the beers malts and hops create a very warm, buttery aroma which is edged by spices such as cloves and cinnamon.  The yeast adds a bread-like note.  In the mouth the malts are indeed buttery and a soft spice prevails throughout.  The hops arent nearly as bitter as Ive seen mentioned, instead they give this beer a subtle grassy taste.  The mouth feel is medium thick with a velvety carbonation.  The finish is malty with a mild tartness.  Very nice.

750 ml bottle.
Pours a hazy golden colour with a hazy, frothy, lacy and white head. Small visible yeast particles. At first the aroma is lemon, some hops and grass. Yeast brings the fruitiness. Flavour of sweetish malts, stinging hops, cinnamon and some other spices too. Very smooth mouthfeel with a longlasting mouthfeel of yeast, fruits and hops. A bit warming alcohol finish. This definitely has aging potential.

750 ml bottle. A hazy dark blonde beer with a large, frothy, lacing, mostly lasting white head. The aroma is moderately malty, lightly to moderately hoppy, lightly yeasty, with notes of toasted grains, flowers, herbs, orange peel, spices and exotic fruits. The flavour is moderately sweet, lightly sour, lightly bitter. Medium to full body, slick texture, lively carbonation, dry and quie long finish with medium bitterness, lightlly alcoholic. Not as good as Estivale, for example, but a good tripel, with nice peppery hints. Its also true to style and dangerously drinkable.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2011 Gulfärgad med mycket stort och härligt skum.
Även här fins det tydliga inslag av vete och skumbanan, fast inte så fruktig. Ganska lätt trots sina 8,4 % och en helt ok öl utan större konstigheter.
Very wheaty.  Nice amount of Belgian influence.  One of the lighter triples.  Good starter before the real heavyweights. Pours a light yellow.  Aroma is minor barnyard.

On Tap.  Poured a terrific golden yellow with a white head that looked perfect.  This beer was a terrific tripel: tasted of light yeast, slight citrus with a bitter after, it went down easy with taste of hops.  A very good tripel.
Bottiglia da 75 allO Connor di Genova abbinata con tonno e senape su letto di cime di rapa. Ho capito male o ha luppoli ammeregani? in ogni caso molto molto buona

Beautiful, light orange beer with big and white head. Aroma is stunning, aromatic and fruitfull, spicyness, fructose, tropical fruits and hops. Flavour is fruitfull and quite sweet with quite high bitterness that balancing and dries the aftertaste. Also fruits, spicyness, some pine needles and hint of orange can be found from flavour. Medium palate with medium carbonation, easy and pleasant to drink. Trippel where everything is unbelievable greatly balanced; even the big bottle is empty for too quickly.

Bottle. beautiful beer. Pours as liquid gold with a bright frothy head. Light fruits with flowers and floral hops. Very complex and well balanced. Solid medium+ mouthfeel with the right balance of sweet and yeast.

Dark yellow colored with medium sized white head. Nicely hopped and fresh aroma with orange, some yeast also. Medium bodied. Flavor is even more hopped with fresh grassy note, soft fruits with some orange also here. Excellent triple.

Very good strong dark beer, nice barley and malt notes, decent appearance. Could have more body, but maybe thats just me again. Worth a try for sure.
Had this one at the UDRBM, 31-07-2010. Orange colored brew. Fruity, yeast in the aroma. Flavor has yeast, fruits, some sweetness, some melon. Kinda nice.

Bottle.  Pours hazy gold with a nice big white head.  Small floaties suggest some age.  Aroma has bunches of spicy hops, cereal, and floral accents.  Pungent and enticing.  Flavor has a hit of lemon rind and white pepper, very hoppy.  Middle rides some nice candy orange and malt, and finish has hop bitterness.  Palate is light yet creamy, with a racy finish that blends effervescence and lingering warmth.  A very well put together triple, hoppy yet controlled, with depth throughout.

Bottle @ meeting. Clear orange pour with floaties, small head.
Aroma of fruits, orange, apple, yeast, spices.
Flavour is fruity, spices, mildly bitter, lightly sweet, lots of poperingse hop.
Nice tripel.

75cl Bottle at UDRBM. Clear golden colour with yeast particles floating around, white head. Aroma is spicy, fruity, malty, light flowery. Flavour is light sweet, malty, dry/chalky, spicy, flowery, bitter malty finish. Medium bodied. Nice.

Bottle at Dutch RB Meeting. Slight gusher. Clear golden pour with a thin creamy white head and floaties. Aroma is sweet malty and with fruits, some spices, and slightly buttery. Flavor is sweet fruity, spicy and somewhat bitter in the finish. Nice balance. Creamy texture and average carbonation. Nice tripel.

Really disappointing Tripel--one of the least satisfying Belgian beers Ive ever had.  EXTREME hop character overwhelms other elements of Tripelness, if theyre even there. Funky, chalky aftertaste rounds out a sad "outing"

Bottle at Dempseys. Pours a hazy orange with a medium, white head. Nose of light Belgian character, fruits, some sugar. Flavor is fairly sweet with more fruit notes, slight funkiness, and some spices. Light to medium in body with average carbonation. Not bad, but Ive had better Tripels.
Birra fantastica !! colore giallo intenso schiuma persistente ..sentori di miele mentre al palato sprigiona la sua robustezza.nonostante limportante gradazione alcolica rimane molto "leggera".
Draft. Pours golden with a fizzy white head. Flavor is sugar, apples, and lots of dryness. This is the most dry tripel Ive ever tried.

05 Bottle at Spinnerstown.  Aroma of cherry and raisin.  Dark golden body with medium head.  Nice carbonation still.  Flavor is very sweet and fruity, less citrus and spice then expected, probably due to the age.  Hints of raisin, cherry, malts and maybe a little vanilla.  Cherry finish with a little sour.
abbey tripel drunk at delirium in bruxelles. golden colour white head. fruity aroma and typical belgian yeast flavours. moderate alcoholic after taste

This beer tastes like a typical Triple, but with a slightly bitter taste towards the end.  However, it is a harsher going down than the "average" Triple.

I wouldnt say there is anything special about it, but since Triples are my favorte type of beer, I like it just fine!
UPDATED: MAY 12, 2010 Great fuity american hop nose.  Golden with a soapy white head.  Refreshingly light but nice hop notes, like a pale ale with a touch of belgian yeast.  A great summer beer.

Bottle. Pours orange, cloudy with a big white head. The aroma has got some nice qualities. Notes of clove, honey and sour pears. I dont like the acidy alchol notes though. Excellent fruity and spicy taste. Some vanilla and sour pears aswell. A little dry in the end. Drinkable but not very complex.

Bottle.

Pours golden with a big white head.
Spicy and good but rather simple.

A classic belgian tripel pulled from the cellar bought at Dranken Geers in Belgium. The pour is deep hazy yellow with a neat white head that fades a bit. The nose is the sweet yeast notes like marzipan, figs and vanilla. The taste is disappointing and pale. The nose gave expectations of a better flavour imo.  The palate is medium to light with a ichy feeling and a finish that are yeasty and light bitter. Its good, but I have had better tripels
750 ml bottle a hazy orange colored beer with a white head aroma hop spices yeast and fruits taste spices hop and fruity
Bottle:Hazy brass colour, huge head. Spicy, yeasty, lemony zest aroma. Flavour of hops, citrus, coriander, toffee and some alcohol. A very well balanced and drinkable Triple.
Rustic ale with a base of soft water creates master malts and own barley to craft this ale.  Alcohol overpowers some of the taste.
Aroma is yeast, barnyard, basement aromas, leather. Taste is fresh, a little bit of banana and what was expected from the aroma.

Bottle 75 cl, 2010-04-01, Göteborg
AR: belgium yeast (white bread, sweetcorn), marzipan, white grapes
even more fuitness a few seconds after pouring the first glas.
AP: apricot juice colured body - slightly cloudiness, 3 cm high white extremly creamy and organic foam, wee curtains
F: belgium yeast, banana and some dried citrus fruits peels, fructose, medium bitterness, long and tingling, a bit sprity finish. This is not a starting "beer", start with an less alchol strong one i.e. a Blond Double and it will not be an issue! One of the best ones I have had of this style!
Shared this one w/ SkyCop32. Pours a hazy medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty, hoppy, yeasty. Flavor is moderately sweet, highly alcoholic, citrus.

Bottle (35 cl) from Systembolaget. Hazy deep golden with large rocky head. Oranges and almond paste in the aroma, along with spicy, peppery yeast notes. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Dry and slightly alcoholic finish with a mild bitterness.
Tap at delerium ... hazy yellow ... big white head ... very dull hop nose ... fruity lemon and bananan .. ok
amber with nice head. Aroma from hops and citrus. Taste is light bitter from hops. Also citrus, yeast.. Alcohol is notable. Body medium, smooth texture, finish with light bitterness.

Bottle at St Neots Beer Festival 10, courtesy of the good people from alesbymail.com. Gold with a small white head. Sweet alcoholic aroma with a lingering Belgian spiciness. Sweet malty taste, a little pungent soap and slight bitterness to finish. Rather delightful.

Pours hazy gold with a tiny head.  Aroma is spice and cherry fruit.  Medium in body with light carbonation.  Flavor is pretty typical for a triple with a nice balance of sweet fruit and alcohol.  A nice triple.

Tasted at Zythos Beer Festival, Belgium.
Deep hazy golden beer with an off-white lacing head. Aromas of citrussses, some caramell and vanilla, pineapple. Fruity flavor of orange peel, tangerines, lemon, peaches and fine belgian yeasts. Hoppy, spicy mouthfeel and aftertaste.  Nice tripel one

Bottle from Alesbymail.com. Dark golden pour with a white long lasting head. Aromas of citrus, herbs, barley, vanilla, caramel. Flavours of candied peel, tangerines, lemon zest, peaches. Very fruity. Hoppy, herby mouthfeel. Fruity, hoppy finish. Very good tripel.

colore oro scuro,profumo molto intenso di fiori e lievito.
il suo gusto viene caratterizzato da note di spezie,malto e caramello.
finale secco con una leggera punta di pepe.

750 ml bottle from Bieropholie, shared with Rob, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 27DE09. 
App.:  Orange with lots of flecks of yeast and a thin white head.
  
Aroma:  Very sweet and fruity, floral honey, warm spices, tropical fruits, coriander, juicy orange, apricots, apples, tons of fruit, fairly yeasty.
  
Palate: Medium body, fairly minimal effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Fairly spicy, lots of bread and biscuits, some orange peel and coriander, some honey, apples, a little burnt sugar(?); reasonably sweet with a touch of tang and fair bitterness, particularly for style.

Not often a Tripel fan, but I enjoyed this.

Tap at Maxs.  Hazy golden light brown color, small white head, decent lacing.  Aroma of white pepper, citrus, apple.  Flavor is balanced, body is good, light spice in the background.  Best tripel of the weekend, one of the nicest of the Belgian beer fest.
Orange and hazy. Has a white head, lasting. Yeasty aroma, a bit sharp. Sweet flavor, moderate bitter finish. Creamy texture. Lively carbonation.

Tap at Maxs. One of the highlights after 25+ beers. Pours a glowing clear yellow. Aroma is hoppy, sourdough bread,     Taste is hoppy, light on the palate, and moves to spices (nutmeg, coriander) and light fruits (green pear and tart strawberry) and dry hoppinessy. Very nice- a non sugar bomb tripel for once!
UPDATED: NOV 12, 2011 sweet hoppy aroma,yellow,clear, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, soft carbonation, nice fruit hoppy finish.

on tap at Novare Res ..cloudy light amber pour, thin white head , good lacing. Aroma of Belgian yeast ,lemon and passionfruit . Flavor is malty sweet with notes or coriander, clove , pepper and wood .Dry slightly bitter finish . Soft carbonation , smooth and well balanced .

Sample at the Belgian tasting at Blacklick Wine & Spirits on 1/28/10. Hazy orange/amber pour with a medium off-white head. Funky and grassy aroma with a bit of sweetness. Sweet and fruity flavor giving way to a semi-sweet and super carbonated finish.

Smells of fruit, malt, and hops.  Pours an orange haze with a thin head and some sediment.  Has a bitter, malty taste, with a decent carbonation level, dry finish.  Full body, thick texture.  A solid tripel but not noteworthy.  It does grow on you.

Wife picked me up a bottle at Whole Foods.  Pours and a hazy orange with bunches of chunks floating in it.  Smells of fruit salad.  very refreshing with lots of flavor of fruits and raisins and yeast maybe.  I have quite the cold and havent recovered from vegas trip yet so I may have to rejudge later in life again but as of now I like it.

A: Pours a nice golden honey orange color with a creamy head. There are tons of floaters in the glass. It started as larger pieces, but in the final pour it appears as though ground cinnamon had been poured into the glass only to settle on the bottom. Real pretty beer.

S: A very nice smelling triple. Tons of sweet ripe fruits. Peaches and Apricots mostly with hints of rock candy and nutmeg.

T: Man this one is better than I ever expected. Tons of malty sweetness with sweet fruits plowing thru. There were notes of peaches, apples, and even early season strawberries. A light touch of hop bitterness in the background. Man do those folks in Belgium know how to make some beer.

M: Medium bodied yet sparkling. Soo refreshing will take this one over a bottle of wine any day.
Una delle prime birre artigianali ke ho bevuto.... una triple classica con linconfondibile impronta del birrificio la rulles!

Bottle courtesy of Hogtownharry. Thanks Harry! This triple poured a darker than expected, hazed yellow/orange, with a fizzy but long lived cap, showing some nice lace. Powerful nose was of yeast and fresh citrus, fresh hops, spices, a bit of alcohol, pear, with an interesting woody/earthy sort of dankness. Tasted sweet, but loaded with heavy fresh hopping. Pear, orange, apricot met fresh leafy greens and a bit of burning alcohol. Quite floral and spicy, with a certain woody element. Quite dangerous, even with a obvious presence of alcohol, this was easy to drink. A gem. Thanks Harry!

330ml bottle at the White Horse, Belgian Festival, 30th Aug 09. Bottle was marked BBE Dec 08. Hazy mid amber. Cola cube & cough medicine aroma. Sweet, sugary taste. Too biscuity, not enough zing. Would be interesting to try a fresher bottle.

Is there a better beer than a top notch Belgian Tripel?  The pour is amber with some sediment and a chunky white head and the aroma is sweet, fruity and yeasty.  The flavor is fruit with some bready malts and some yeast with some dryness in the finish.  There is certainly some alcohol throughout, but nothing offensive.  A tasty tripel, one that I would certainly buy again.

A bit of spice in the aroma. Great tasting head. Lots of chunks in the beer. This is interesting. Bottle says triple but this seems like a bier de garde to me. Crisp, funky, a lot of bite. Great finish. Excellent.

gusher, pours out very clear pale gold with a bright white tall bubbly head.  the body is super clear and gold with a decent amount of bubbles rising up from the bottom of the glass.  there is decent, somewhat thick lacing around the glass and the head settled to a nice thin cap.  the aromas are kind of week but i do pick up green apple, slight pine, yeast, and something bitter to the nose, but not hops, cant figure it out.  it is slightly thin in the begining but is mostly a medium bodied brew.  the taste is kind of sweet and very malty and plesent.  i pick up a little smoke(believe it or not), apple, grape, sweet dried up onion(but not spicy), and maybe some acidicy from a tomatoe or possibly watered down vinegar.  it is a little sour and dry in the finish and leaves a lingering, not so great aftertaste that i do not particualry care for.  not that bad though, will drink again if someone else pays for it.

bière tres équilibrer entre alcool et houblon avec des notes sur les agrumes ( ananas), une tres bonne carbonatation pour une refermenatation en bouteille la meilleur biere de cette brasserie a lheure actuel

Bottle. Hazy deep orangeish golden colour with mediumsized white creamy head, that leaves nice lace. Aroma is fruits, nectar/honey, some caramel malts and mild note sof some herbs and yeast as well. Flavour is being quite much the same. Quite dry finish.

750 ml bottle from Tanakaya.  
Fruity aroma with honey, plums, apples and a touch of citrus and brown sugar. Glowing, medium amber color with a bit more than lace. Very unexplosive. Sweet, fruity, honey-and-caramel flavor that lightens into apples and lemon at the mid-palate, these remaining and getting hoppy and more citric at the finish. Very interesting. Starts out seeming too sweet, but changes. Palate is rich and full, thinning toward the end. Really fascinating.
From a bottle poured copper color with a good amount of head.  Nice spice malty flavor with a quick finish.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy orange amber body with a white head.  Fruity esters apple, coriander, peach with some wood.  Spicy with cloves, tea and a mild breadiness.  Mild warming with a bitter finish. Nice.

750ml bottle (Kaisla, Helsinki, Big Bottle Weeks)
Slightly sickly sweet aroma, fleshy fruits. Harsh carbonation at first. Very bitter body, but big light grains too. Some alcohol, but the grains are tasty. Fruity and hoppy finish. Better than their blonde in that it had some hops to it. However, still not crisp enough for my taste.
Pours cloudy honey with white head. Very honey taste with malts. Very smooth mouthfeel with carbonation. Pleasant mouth feel with nice carbonation. Good beer but okay trippel.

Samples at Fête Bière et Saveurs. Nice aroma of banana, yeasty esters. Some hops. Taste is hoppy with banana and yeast. Some alcohol on the taste, quite warm on the finish. Quite dry. Very good triple overall. Would like to sample again.

Draught (Delirium, Brussels) - Hazy gold/amber with a white head. Pineapple, peach and spice feature in the aroma. Hoppy and slightly spicy taste with hints of pineapple, tea, grapefruit and peach. The finish is hoppy, fruity, spicy and dry.
Sampled @ Bieres et Saveur 09.09.07 : Dark yellow no head average carbonation. Light cereal. Fruity citrus can be smell. Alcohol is well hidden. Med body.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a thick white head with some nice sedimentation. Aroma of fruits, especially citrus, with hints of wheat and barley. Good body. Very tasty trpel.
bottled, pours orangy-brown. with a fairly large tan head. Aromas of orange, grapefruit and sugary malt. Flavor are the same with grass and bitters. An average triple at best.

750 shared with 502flavors.  Cloudier color as compared to the Super Baladin - hazy orange with the same sediment throughout.  Smooth over the palate, very little carbonation.  Flavor is nice, wheat, a little spice from the yeast and some sweetness from the malts.  A nice balanced tripel but I dont think Id come back to it.

750 shared.  But of a gushing bottle.  Hazy wheat beer looking orangish/yellowish with small white head and lots of yeast floaties.  Smells like soft round wheat beer - yeast, clove, spice. Flavor is the same: wheaty, cereal, clove, yeast, and spice. Medium to light body with medium to low carbonation.  Overall: fine, but not special.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange body with small white head. Aroma is honey and sweet malt. The flavor is honey with a nice, smooth mouthfeel.
Colore ambra leggero e opaco,aroma maltato e speziato.Anche il gusto è speziato,di legno.Buona la maltatura che la rende dolce.Davvero buona!

Pours hazy orange with a medium yellow/white head.
Aroma is pale malt, apricot fruitiness, light yeast.
Medium sweet malt body, biscuity, light fruity tartness.
Light bitter finish.

Drank from the tap in Brussels.

Decent overall, a little to sweet for my liking.

750ml Bottle:  Aroma of yeast, biscuit, pale malts, slight fruit, slight wood, and some pollen.  Poured orange/amber in color with a medium-sized white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of small and medium-sized particles throughout.  Flavor is light to medium sweet.  Tastes of honey, slight spices, light hops, yeast, slight biscuit, malts, slight vanilla, light wood, and a slight hint of citrus.  Medium body.  Lightly dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Sweet, malt, hop, and honey finish is lightly dry.
Bottle at NB-Symposium. Cloudy amber - white head. Vegetables, fruity, sweetness, honey, spicy, light hoppy, light toasted, flowery, light sourish, some yeast-esters, peppery. OK.

Flowery, yeasty, hazy golden brew.
Flavor is flowery, sweet, marmelad and hops. Good palate. Round and not to pepery and big.

Bottle - 750ml. Pours a hazy blond body with average carbonation and a thin white foamy head. Well balanced malty/hoppy aroma with herbal and flowery hints. Alcohol is very well hidden. 750 ml bottle.  Pours a hazy gold color with a sizable white head.  Nose is grainy with notes of bubble gum, yeast, and alcohol. Had this from Bottle at Dilirium as a challenge for hops.  Must say it was almost an IPA with some excessive bitter notes but pretty good.  Golden, slightly cloudy, well balanced with a nice head and lacing

On Tap at Delirium Brussels.  Pours a dark golden amber color with a small white head.  Aroma is sweetly fruits, fresh hoppy yeasty bitterness in the flavor along with the fruity notes.  A little thinner than desired.

Bottle.  Orange gold with a large white foam and some yeast floaties.  Aromas are citrus and yeast with grapefruit.  Fresh and floral.  Flavours are pink grapefruit with sugar and yeast.  Resinous grapefruit with yeast.  Fresh and clean on the palate.  Very fruity.  Good.

15/03 0.75 l bottle from beershop.hr, shared with Doggythedog. Poured dark orange body with small to medium sized head and black yeast particles inside. Amarillo hops again in the aroma, much less than in Estivale, but still dominating over (different, sweeter) orange yeast and honey malt. Flavor is pretty similar, slightly bitter citrus hoppy with good honey, caramel and vanilla malt base. Full bodied with longer finish. A fine hoppy tripel, but nothing special.
cloudy gold blond coloured body with a white head a fruity hoppy aroma a fruity hoppy sweet taste with a hoppy bitter finish

Pours a pale honey gold with a one finger white head. The nose is very earthy, very yeasty, mildly sweet, big Belgian influence. The flavor is very earthy and yeasty, lightly sweet, spicy. Palate is mildly sweet and well carbonated. The yeast character becomes almost overwhelming.

Draught @ Zythos 2009. A little hazy golden colored beer, with a thick foamy white head. The aroma of malts with fruits like citrus, some hops. The taste is fruity like citrus and orange. There are hop bitters with malts. Notes of wood and spices. The aftertaste is nice bittersweet.

0.75l bottle from the Beershop shared with heavy (thanks!). Poured a beautiful darker orange body, medium-small white head. Fine American hops in the nose, oranges, honey, typical Rulles (which isnt a bad thing).  The taste is fine and full, hop again, agrumey, on the bitter side. Some honey, somewhat yeasty. Light pine. A fine hoppy tripel, not too flashy, tasty.
Blond coloured beer with small white head and few carbonation. Herby spicy aroma. Full palate. finish is herby and bit bitter.

Draught at zythos bierfestival 2009.  Cloudy yellow colour with an average frothy white head. Aroma is yeast, spicy and peppery. Flavor is very sweet with strong notes of over ripe fruits. Bitter finish.
draught at Zythos beerfest 2009, soft beer gentle in the throat, hoppy taste and good tripel
Zythos 2009. Bittery spicy beer with fruity aromas and a watery texture (really hard to say when tasting so much different beers).

Cloudy, golden with a hint of orange to the colour. Head is medium sized with good retention. Aroma is tropical, bananna and green apple aon the nose. Mouthfeel is light but creamy with a noticeable bit of spice in the initial taste. Apricot with a hint of some sort of grassy herbs and a nice smooth finish.

Tap at Lucky Baldwins.  Brian was selling the pants off this thing.  No striking aroma to speak of, and flavor is a bit too much like a Belgian Pale - no thickness or Trappist quality.  I quote BrotherGrendel: "A middle of the road Tripel with a bit too much lingering bitterness for the style."

This tripel "rulles" (I know, Im hilarious). Nice hazy golden appearance with substantial white head.  Fruity, yeasty aroma, with some floral hops.  Complex flavor with light fruits, spices, and yeast.  Hoppy finish, smooth palate.  Refreshing and satisfying.

Draught at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, Roma. September 08. Pours a hazy amber with a a dense head that diminished. Spicy and yeast aroma. Flavour of fruit, spices and alcohol. Hoppy, dry and bitter finish.

Purchased from Knightly Spirits in Orlando, thanks SoLan!  Pours a cloudy golden color with modest white foam that dissipates. Aroma is light fruits, honey, floral, yeast, grass, and spices. Taste is thick pilsner malt with sweet bread and light fruits, belgian yeast, and floral-grassy hops bitter up the aftertaste. Medium-full bodied, moderate-high carbonation, chewy texture. A middle of the road Tripel with a bit too much lingering bitterness for the style.

In the 750 mL bottle from Beertopia. Pours a hazy rich golden color with a medium ivory head. The aroma is perfume honey and fruit. The taste is extremely sweet with lots of cane sugar and honey. A mild tartness and hidden bitterness finished the beer. Overall it is just too much sweetness.

Bottled(750ml). -Pours a pale amber color with medium sized white head and flowery nose. Lively carbonation. Malty, yeasty and fruity with notes of hops and spices (mostly coriander). Dry fruity finish.

Pours a translucent hoeny color with a decent head.  Aroma is yeast, banana, and spice.  Tastes fruity, banana and pineapple with bread and malt.  tingly mouthfeel,  finishes with a touch of bitterness.  Very good.

Pours a thick gold with small head.  Big yeasty nose with fruit.  Flavor is thick with malt and yeast that just coats the mouth, with a touch of pineapple that climbs out towards the end.  Nice creamy texture.

75cl bottle @ VinensVerden, Odense. Pours unclear amber/orange with a creamy head & lacings. Fruity orange, yeast & hops. Good smooth mouthfeel. Very fresh with orange fruit, a bit of spices (coriander) & hops dominating. Nice!

Pours golden with a nice head and lacing, I didn’t swirl the yeast so it was pretty clear with good carb, aroma is malts and sugar, taste is a nice combo of malt, yeast and hop character, a bit thin IMO but I suppose the sugar does that. 8.4% alcohol is well hidden. Very nice beer

2006 bottle tasted Nov 2008.

Pours a lovely gold but with tons of suspended particles, not quite in des Rocs territory but otherwise pretty far out there on the scale. Looks like it might be a bit flat from the pour, but plentiful carbonation erupts in small bubbles on the tongue; just right. Soft citric aroma, slightly grassy, maybe some honey. Lovely mellow flavor, lots of lemon zest, some peach, gently sweet, honey malts, not intensely spicy, just laid back and really enjoyable to drink. After 2+ years, relatively little of the floral hops that other reviewers have noted; I should try this one fresh as well. Quite an enjoyable and well crafted tripel, probably somewhat underrated on this site.

Pours hazy golden orange with off white head. Aromas of bread dough, spices and slight hoppiness. Sweet with spices, yeast, citrus and hops. Reminds me Chouffe Houblon but not quite as good. Medium body with lively carbonation. A pretty good beer.

Bottle, bought @ Utobeer, London. Enjoyed in Stansted Airport.
Pours muddy orange with a big, frothy, off-white head. Wonderful aroma, lots of fruit. Yeast, oranges, pineapple and grapes. Fine, creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is lightly tart, quite hoppy, lightly warming. Great pineapple, apple, citrus and oranges. Some coriander and pepper. But especially the hoppiness lifts this above the crowd.

This one exploded.  The yeast just misted through the whole bottle, and the pour is a dirty blonde with a still suspension of particles obscuring it.  Dandelion and sourish adhesive aroma.  Coriander.  Brown spices, surprisingly pungent and damp; cardamom, mace, and maybe turmeric.  Salt, and some brown sugar.  Lots of variables, some of them pretty unique.  It has some appealing dirtiness and farm-like textures that spin it in a Fantome vein every so often.
 
Bitter and dry pithy citrus and green spice flavors.  A certain golden dry graininess seems more in line with sunflower seeds and the earthiest of wildflower honeys than it does with the sweetened dough and candi sugar crunch of a prototypical example.  The haze of mystery is heavy.  Vinous textures are deep, surprisingly, as the dryness here at times seems quite tannic and wooden.  The flavors of hazelnuts, almonds, and pistachios really do a fantastic job of making the dryness of the beer soft and earthy, and bitter enough to sidestep the sugary, syrupy flavors that are a bit disdainful to me; likewise, there’s a delicate floral quality and enough sourish funk to make it interesting beyond its already complicated exteriors.

Wildflower honey texture.  Soft and bright.  Gentle carbonation and a medium-full palate.  The departures here take positive directions, and it’s overall very pleasant; a fine effort from a fine brewery.

Hazed golden to light brown pour with a moderate but good bodied head.  Aromas of yeast and floral hops. Not as fruity a nose as other triples. Fine mouth feel, but far from bold.  Quite hoppy for a triple.  Somewhat of a stretch of this style as it doesnt have the fruit and spice I associate with triples.  Yet, nicely done. Some sweetness in the mouth filling flavor but not dominant at all.  There are some subtle spices.  Its a hoppier than the average triple with a good yeast blast.  Alcohol, spice and fruits are there, just hard to discern.  An interesting triple.
Pours a hazy orange with some sidiment seen. Small head. Not much aroma here. Few hops, sweet but not overly. Some citrus. Very enjoyable beer. A+

Pour is a hazy yellow with a small white head.  Aroma is sweet and creamy with some citrus fruit.   Flavor is sort of bland and boring.  Some grain and sweet malts but very bland and almost flat.  Maybe this is a bad bottle as so many others rated this high but as it is this is not a good triple.
Hazy dark straw in color. Flavors of corriander, lightly sweet, hints of yeast, lightly floral. My wife says it taste like "purple". Blame Homer
La mia Abbey Tripel preferita. Forse un po troppo beverina (per chi dopo si deve mettere al volante)

On tap at Delirium, Brussels, 25-07-08   Difficult to determine the colour of this beer in the cave like surroundings of this cellar bar but it looks golden. This is really quite assertively hoppy there is a soft restrained bitterness, nice tanginess and there are slight comparisons with one of the De Ranke products probably XX bitter. The strength is noticeable but never intrusive a lovely beer.

Draft at Monk’s Cafe 7/23/2008Aroma - Light stone fruit, honey, floral and spicy notes, very inviting aroma Appearance - Deep gold with large creamy head that was durable with nice lace in a tulip glass. Flavor - Fruity sweetness balances well with a spicy bitterness. Unexpectedly rich, medium body with light carbonation, very smooth, and a softly dry palate. Very drinkable, smooth and quite satisfying. Went well with the muscles steamed with Dupont Saison.
75cl, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex brew, balanced, hazy, good head, very good brew, the best of the Rulles-range

Bottle from Rivers Bend.  Poured hazy orange color with a huge frothy head that lasted with excellent lacing. Complex spicy fruit and yeasty aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture. Medium fruity balanced flavor with a medium sweet finish of long duration with a small alcohol bite. This is a good beer.

Aroma of caramel, malt and alcohol.  Color is a golden orange with good carbonation and a thin tight head.  Taste is sweet and fruity.  Starting with a medium body it goes down with a very smooth feel.  Finish comes in sweet with an apple taste, a little yeast and a very faint bitterness.  After taste is alcohol then a mellow dry feel.  Good Belgian Triple, not one of the best, but the apple note makes it unique.

Bottle into chalice. Pours a hazy gold with a big, creamy white head, would be a great looking beer if not for all the floaties in there. Aroma is spicy yeast, over-ripe pears, candy sugar, herbal. Taste begins malty but a bit dry; candy sweetness is subtle rather than prominent, held in check in part by an herbal note. Spicy yeast is there also, coupled with a touch of spicy alcohol on the bittersweet, fruity finish with a definite floral hop presence. Feels slightly restrained, subtle. Mouthfeel is creamy, with a subtle carbonation and full mouthfeel. Interesting, different but well done.

75cl bottle from Habersham Liquors (Savannah, GA). Pours a cloudy golden caramel color with a thick, frothy white head that settles slowly and provides ample lacing on the glass. Aroma is apple, pear, candy sugar, caramel. straw, grass, and wheat. Taste is very sweet with notes of caramel, toffee, apple, banana, and spice. Medium-bodied ale with pear on the finish, but finishes a little too quickly. Overall a respectable tripel ale, definitely drinkable.

@Ginger Man-on tap-pours a dissipating white head and yellow color.  Aroma is floral, sweet grain, white grapes, alcohol.  Taste is floral, sweet grain, white grapes, alcohol, yeast, metallic, dry.  If an American brewery would seem an OK effort but

White thick full lasting head. Cloudy light amber colour. Aroma is malty, fruity (apricots, apples) with light citrus and floral notes. Flavor is malty too, fruity with peach and light nutty and herbal tones, ending in a balanced slightly hoppy finish. Medium bodied.

Pours a hazy gold with creamy white head. Aroma is floral, light caramel and alcohol. Spices i cant put my finger on. Flavor is malty dryness, some apple or pear, something similar, full silky body. One of my personal favorites.
Draft at the Gingerman, NYC. Poured a cloudy blonde with a thin head. Spicy and slightly hoppy nose.Similar flavors, with a bit of an alcohol bit. Had some wheat like qualities to it.

Yellow gold. Tiny-bubbled, densely packed foam adorns the glass with wispy lace patterns. Lively floral and herbal hop scents line the nose. Secondary notes of creamed peaches, plasticy phenols, pistachios, and candy sugar. Snug, fluffy carbonation. Creamy yeast foundation and a medley of vibrant tropical-fruit esters softly embrace the zippy and succulent floral hops. Fluffiness of the malt is beautifully mirrored by its crisp crackery definition which underscores the immaculate attenuation. Zingy notes of cantaloupe, mango, and Juicy Fruit gum are illuminated by the brisk, crackly phenols. Peppery yeast lends lots of character. Hops generate a dab of resins which coat the palate but do not detract from the lustrous array of subtleties. Though not to detrimental levels, a distant note of aspirin rigidly exudes. Bitterness is otherwise  squeaky clean due to the delightfully pillowy yeastiness which gently softens its blow. Alcohol is brilliantly concealed throughout. Herbal- and lime-tinged bitterness gracefully penetrates the soft malt and yeast toward the finish. Closes dryish and elegantly with a blend of pear, green raisins, zesty hops, and creamy yeast. A rather rustic and earthy Triple which is largely defined by its characterful strain (Orval) of yeast. Just short of extravagant.

text: A highly enjoyable trippel.  Hazy golden pour with an ample two finger rocky head.  A bit of apricots initially, prevalent yeastiness, with some hints of spice, and a surprising amount of bitterness in the finish.  Rounds out to be pretty clean and quaffable.
golden hazy appearance with huge white head.  flavor is tremendous with some spicy notes and a sweet fruity finish.  tastes like a champagne yeast may be used

Pours amber and slightly darker than the other tripels I sampled.  Smells of honey, citrus, molasses, some spice, hints of ginger.  Tastes of light earthy malt, some crisp dry hints, lots of spice, coriander, a hint of bitterness.  Enjoyable.
Ho un sonno terribile, è lora che vado a dormire; comunque sta birra è veramente ottima provatela.

Color: Honey brown with white foamy head and heavy lacing. Lots of suspended, flocculated yeast. 

Nose: Soft and honeyed, caramel, yeast and bready notes. 

Palate: Thick and heavy palate; big caramel malt. Bready and doughy with a touch of coriander on the finish.

750 ml. Amber-orange with a few floaties and a two-finger, lasting head. Spicy apples and earthy brown sugar aroma. Bubblegum, cinnamon, alcohol, and slightly bitter earth-spiced caramel apple flavors. Maybe some slight sour leather and figs as well. Creamy-smooth, medium body is slightly dry and tingly.

On tap:  Cloudy yellow in color with aromas of baking yeast, honey, ripe citrus fruits and spice.  The palate was soft and not very powerful but smooth.  While nothing stood out for me it was definitely enjoyable.
mild belgian beer, doughy strong yeast. Aroma of light, sweet fruits.very mild beer. Nothing special jumped out at me with this one.
Bottle (75cl). Amber colored hazy body with medium size dense off-white head. Malt and fruit in the nose. Flavour dominated by a nice sweet feeling with malt alt hops.
750ml bottle. Intially served too cold... had a metallic taste. As warmed up, fruityness disappeared, became hoppy with a slight bitterness.

750ml.  Clear straw colored pour with a lot of visible bubbles and a white head.  Pretty classic triple aroma - spices (coriander), orange zest, candi sugar, with alcohol and some funk in the background.  Flavor is similar with lots of the malt showing the back half.  Slightly metallic, but it doesnt detract except in the finish.  Highly carbonated with lots of small bubbles.  Above average.

Bottled 0,75L.
Creamy and adherent head of good persistence. Lightly orange and fraught  yellow color with discreet fizzy aspect and sufficient sediment presence. Flowery, alcoholic, sweet aroma, honey and stum. Solid and wrapping taste, much persistent and warmth end.
Bottle. Low but lasting white head. Hazy yellow body. Fruity sweet aroma. Relatively sweet and unagressive for a tripel, medium hopped. Low carbonation. Long aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2008 750 bottle with a cool label poured a nice golden in color with a thick initial head falling back to become a thin layer with nice lacing. aroma has spicy yeast, caramel, sweet fruit, spice, and barnyard funk. mouth feel is on the thin side with a nice coating of the tongue. flavor hits with spiced yeast, malt, hay and grass. hops become present, good barnyard funk, and finishing with light sweetness on the dry side. a touch of bitterness and fruit top it off. real nice beer towards the spiced side just lacking body.

Amber color with a white head. Nice smell is earthy, grainy with a bubble gum sweetness. Medium bodied. Has a mildly sweet pale malt, spicy yeasty flavor. Finish is on the dry side. Nice label shows a troll holding a brewski...Enjoyable. 5197

Aroma is of nice farmhouse, sweet malts and citrus fruit with a hint of spice.  Taste is of light malts well blended with subtle earthy hops, lemon, honey and spice.  Slightly crisp with a creamy texture and good carbonation.  Ending is of a nice mix of subtle bitter and sweet notes.  ~YUMMY~  Thanks Volgon!

Bottle:  Pours a hazy orange with tons of floaties under a decent white head, hay, barnyard, lemon and faint grassy spices, medium bodied, velvet mouthfeel with tingles of carbonation at the end, starts and ends lightly sweet with a smooth ending.

Green bottle, 75 cl, via Importations Privées Bièropholie, savoured on March 1 2008; eye: light orange, hazy, suspended matter, white head made up of rather large bubbles, lacing, no effervescence; nose: tropical fruity, yeast, slightly spice (a bit of pepper), light floral; mouth: creamy, fruity, lightly spicy (a bit of pepper), a bit of yeast, refreshing, a bit of lime, finale is a bit dry but fruity with a good presence of yeast, light astringency, lightly sweet, slightly bitter, medium body, not much carbonation; overall: quite likable
